question: 伯母
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>chief</kanji> <kanji>mother</kanji> isn't your own mother, but she is the chief of your mother. She's your mother's lady sibling, who has always owned your mom. She's the chief mother. She's your <vocabulary>aunt</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading for the <ja>母</ja> part is just the first <ja>は</ja> in <ja>はは</ja>, rendaku'd. You can also think of your <vocabulary>aunt</vocabulary> as a sheep, too, if you'd like.
